content: May 4 (Reuters) - Greek industrial and energy group Mytilineos reported a 72% year-on-year surge in its first-quarter core profit on Thursday, helped by a jump of around 50% in the profitability of its renewables unit.

The results were also boosted by the group's stronger presence in the supply and trading of natural gas in southeastern Europe.The Athens-based group reported earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) of 225 million euros ($249 million), compared with 130 million euros a year earlier, while its net profit was up 113% year-on-year to 143 million euros.($1 = 0.9023 euros) (Reporting by Antonis Pothitos in Gdansk; Editing by Mark Potter)
